scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-484 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-484 is a star with 0.96 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.87 times its radius. It is located 1246.36 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.48 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-484 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-484 system


Kepler-484 b

Kepler-484 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2016-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-484 b is 5.819 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-484 b is 2.280 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-484 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-484, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-484 - System With 1 Exoplanet
